intro: Strychnos atlantica, commonly known as the Atlantic strychnos, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and dry forest habitats. Due to its toxicity, it is important to handle the plant with care.
